h1: How to Implement ISR with MongoDB in Next.js 15
content:
Why ISR + MongoDB?

Incremental Static Regeneration (ISR) allows you to create and update static pages after build time. Combined with MongoDB, you get the best of both worlds: dynamic content with static performance.

The Problem

Traditional SSR (Server-Side Rendering) queries the database on every request. This works for small traffic, but at scale:

  • Increased database load
  • Slower response times
  • Higher costs

ISR solves this by caching pages and revalidating them periodically.
